{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rabies vaccine is given as a preventive measure after a potential exposure to the rabies virus. Rabies is primarily transmitted through the bite of an infected animal. Therefore, the rabies vaccine should be given in case of any animal bite that has the potential to transmit the virus. Rat bites, cat bites, dog bites, and monkey bites all have the potential to transmit rabies. Therefore, the correct answer is none of the above options.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
